timeline.title: Intern at GlaxoSmithKline Biologicals (GSK)
timeline.details: During my internship, I was introduced to coding in VBA by a colleague. I then used it to automate a small portion of my tasks. This was my first introduction to coding, and first lit the spark in me to begin learning it on my own.

timeline.title: Lab Technician at Chemical Industries Limited (CIL)
timeline.details: While taking the course, I was working full-time at a laboratory. I was learning Python in my own free time to see if any of the tasks at work could be automated. I eventually found that most of them were, but left before I was able to bring those ideas up. After seeing the automation process replicated at home, I was inspired to continue to learn.

timeline.title: Specialist Diploma in Environmental Management and Applied Water Technology
Manufacturing Technologist at Micron Semiconductor
timeline.details: While executing my primary job duties, I spotted an area of improvement, where all stakeholders could not see an overview of information unless they manually looked it up with multiple applications, which was extremely time-consuming even for a single datum. The information needed to be viewed multiple times for different tools, multiple times in a day. I wrote SQL queries and developed a Tableau dashboard to help solve this problem, fixing issues and upgrading the dashboard with additional features as needed. I wrote Microsoft Excel VBA code to upgrade existing reports and amended/created other SQL queries when requested. In my personal time, I learnt front and back-end web development and some web development frameworks and put those skills to work on some projects. Currently, I am learning machine learning in Python using scikit-learn, along with data analysis tools such as Numpy, Pandas, Seaborn, and Matplotlib.

timeline.title: Specialist Diploma in Automation and Robotics
timeline.details: I learnt about robotic programming, sensors, and assembly of electromechanical systems. More importantly, I learnt about PLC programming with ladder diagram programming, function block diagrams, structured text programming, and instruction lists. I had hands-on experience with controlling inputs (examples include sensors and buttons) and outputs (pneumatic actuators, lights, and buzzers). In the course, I also learnt about machine vision and attended labs where we worked with a machine vision program. In addition, the course also covered data communication and networks.
